review: It is usually pretty good at starting videos, but often fails to stop, pause, and rewind videos. It is still better than plugging my computer into the HDMI input on my TV.

review: Initially bought this to use BubbleUPNP on my home network. For that purpose (and everything else I've tried with it), it excels. Setup is rather simple (Just had to download an app to my Android phone for configuration) and it "just works". Streaming youtube to the TV is rather effortless (There's an additional button on my  phone's UI to stream to Chromecast), and it has had little to no problems displaying the stream from BubbleUPNP.The only single downside i can think of is that you *MUST* be connected to the internet to use the Chromecast at all. Even if you have media hosted on your home network, you (as far as I can tell) can't stream anything to the Chromecast without an active internet connection when you start. (I've had the internet cut out after an in-home stream started and it continued with no problems.) While this shouldn't be an issue for most users or buyers, it means that you can't use the Chromecast as a network streaming solution without an internet connection present. This was a little annoying, but not enough to dock a star. (Especially considering the value you're otherwise getting in this device)
